channel.title: Deleting global objects [deltabased317]
channel.description: basically my home sucks atm because there are random object everywhere...i have a ::deleteobj (xcoord) (ycoord) command...but when i use it, it deletes but then next time i recomplie the server they are back...i think it is because commands can not open the global objects folder (partly because there isnt one) but anyways...i need a way to delete global objects. keep in mind i do not have a global objects folder. instead i have a world map folder.

item.title: Deleting global objects [deltabased317]
item.dc:creator: @RoidScape.Darkbb RoidScape.Darkbb
item.description:
@RoidScape.Darkbb wrote:

thanks for both of your guys help…i will try both of these in my next update thanks

item.title: Deleting global objects [deltabased317]
item.dc:creator: @Acrodox Acrodox
item.description:
@Acrodox wrote:

Put this right above your “makeGlobalobject” stuff in client.java

deletethatobject(XCRD, YCRD);

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting global objects [deltabased317]
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Search in Client.Java:

public void Deleteobjects() {

You should know what to do after that.
